page.title: 07A WALK IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: It is early summer.The many different trees are in full fresh-green leaf:elm birch,rowan, and beech. On the upper slopes the darker spruces and other conifers bear their red and yellow male and female flowers. Overhead a kestrel hovers.House- martins swoop under the eaves with mud in their beaks,busy repairing their nests.By the roadside,bloom forget-me-nots,pink campion,greater stitchwort and other tiny wild flowers. In the woods a red squirrel leaps from tree to tree,while below glow the colours of violets, sorrel,and blue- bells.A startled roe-deer bounds away into cover,and a red-combed capercaillie with its fan-shaped tail,feeds on pine shoots.
